content:
• Wednesday, August 10, 2011
  • JNPR

    A variety of networking, optical component, and communications chip names are up AH on the heels...

    A variety of networking, optical component, and communications chip names are up AH on the heels of Cisco's FQ4 results and FQ1 guidance. JNPR +1.6%. BRCD +3.9%. ALU +2.8%. AMCC +5.6%. JDSU +4.4%. CIEN +2.6%. CAVM +4.1%. FNSR +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    During its FQ4 earnings call, Cisco stated it expects FQ1 revenue growth of 1%-4%, implying a...

    During its FQ4 earnings call, Cisco stated it expects FQ1 revenue growth of 1%-4%, implying a range whose midpoint is slightly above consensus. The company also mentioned its VP headcount has been cut by 17%, and that switching and routing orders were strong at the end of the quarter. CSCO now +7.8% AH. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • BZH

    Beazer Homes (BZH -11.4%) took a beating today - the biggest decliner in the homebuiling sector...

    Beazer Homes (BZH -11.4%) took a beating today - the biggest decliner in the homebuiling sector - after reporting a wider-than-expected FQ3 loss late yesterday. The company continues to struggle to contain costs and return to profitabilty in what seems to be an endlessly slumping housing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENS

    EnerSys (NYSE:ENS): FQ1 EPS of $0.68 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $569M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $19M....

    EnerSys (NYSE:ENS): FQ1 EPS of $0.68 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $569M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $19M. Expects FQ2 EPS at $0.53-$0.57 (excl. $0.04 restructuring program and acquisition expenses) decline q/q due to higher commodity cost and operating cost of new Chongqing facility, and the residual effects from a three-week strike at European plants. Shares -11.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • JAGGF

    After a string of losses, Jaguar Mining (NYSE:JAG) reports a Q2 profit on an increase in...

    After a string of losses, Jaguar Mining (NYSE:JAG) reports a Q2 profit on an increase in production. Revenue soared 64% Y/Y, as the gold miner benefited from high prices and heavy demand for gold. Shares +12.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • BAC

    After plunging yet again today and seeing its CEO grilled by disgruntled investors, Bank of...

    After plunging yet again today and seeing its CEO grilled by disgruntled investors, Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) is up 3% AH. StreetInsider.com suggests rumors regarding the sale of BofA's stake in China Construction Bank are driving the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • NWS

    More from the News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS) earnings: Full-year net income of $2.74B ($1.04/share), up...

    More from the News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS) earnings: Full-year net income of $2.74B ($1.04/share), up 7.9%. Results include $254M loss on sale of Myspace. Murdoch on nonfinancial "challenges" at shuttered tabloid News of the World: "We are acting decisively ... There has been no material impact on our other operations."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • NWS

    News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS): FQ4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $8.96B (+11% Y/Y) beats by...

    News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS): FQ4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $8.96B (+11% Y/Y) beats by $0.5B. Income improvement in all segments, led by television. Shares +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • KAR

    KAR Auction Services (KAR -17%) crashes after reporting yesterday that Q2 sales were below...

    KAR Auction Services (KAR -17%) crashes after reporting yesterday that Q2 sales were below analysts' estimates, as merger expenses and fewer numbers of autos at auction adversely impacted gross margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • PRXL

    Shares of Parexel (PRXL +9.3%) jump after the firm raised its FY12 outlook on revenue to...

    Shares of Parexel (PRXL +9.3%) jump after the firm raised its FY12 outlook on revenue to $1.36B-$1.4B, from $1.34-$1.38B, and received an upgrade from Jefferies to Hold. Revenue only jumped 5% Y/Y for the firm, but backlogs increased 29% on new business wins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • AOL

    AOL is down another 7.8% today following weak Q2 results, as investors become skeptical that...

    AOL is down another 7.8% today following weak Q2 results, as investors become skeptical that online advertising growth can offset declining dial-up revenue. Nicholas Carlson points out how AOL is investing enormous sums in its Patch local news network, but refuses to give details on monetization (perhaps with good reason).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • C

    Bank stocks (XLF -6%) near their lows of the day: C -9.2%, BAC -8.7%, JPM -4.7%. Analysts point...

    Bank stocks (XLF -6%) near their lows of the day: C -9.2%, BAC -8.7%, JPM -4.7%. Analysts point out that U.S. banks are much better capitalized than they were in 2008, but with European banks smashed on scary rumors of banks at death's door, investors don't seem to care right now.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • IVZ

    Invesco (IVZ -9.5%) trades lower after reporting late yesterday that July assets under...

    Invesco (IVZ -9.5%) trades lower after reporting late yesterday that July assets under management were flat for the month. Considering market losses thus far in August, the mutual-fund manager is on track to rack up around $2B in total net outflows during 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • IPAR

    Inter Parfums (IPAR -15%) takes a hit after the perfume company's Q2 earnings fell short, as...

    Inter Parfums (IPAR -15%) takes a hit after the perfume company's Q2 earnings fell short, as top-line sales were hit by inventory delays in its European-based operations. Q2 shipments were delayed until Q3 due to "unforeseen transitional issues" connected with the June opening of its distribution center outside Paris.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +1.1%) spikes to highs of the day on renewed speculation, launched weeks ago,...

    InterDigital (IDCC +1.1%) spikes to highs of the day on renewed speculation, launched weeks ago, that the company is an attractive target for Google (GOOG -3.2%) and others. In its attempts to acquire more patents, Google needs to build a “moat” of its own patents to avoid future litigation battles, and IDCC would fit the bill.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks are one of the day's few pockets of strength, boosted by Jefferies' upgrade of...

    Solar stocks are one of the day's few pockets of strength, boosted by Jefferies' upgrade of First Solar (FSLR +4%) to Buy from Hold, citing the lowest cost-per-watt among solar module makers and the lowest cost of capital on projects thanks to U.S. government loans. Among other solar names: SPWRA +1%, STP +4.1%, TSL +2.5%, LDK +6.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • SVRA

    Microcap Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX) shares plummet -56% after the FDA rejects a new...

    Microcap Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX) shares plummet -56% after the FDA rejects a new application for the development-stage drug maker's lung-cancer treatment Exelbine. The agency says the authenticity of the drug products used in its pivotal bioequivalence trial could not be verified.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • EQNR

    Brigham Exploration (BEXP +7.5%) adds to yesterdays gains, following multiple upgrades and...

    Brigham Exploration (BEXP +7.5%) adds to yesterdays gains, following multiple upgrades and upside target adjustments by the Street on the back of its strong earnings report on Monday: Global Hunter upgrades to buy, FBR ups to outperform and Jefferies reiterates a buy, raising its price target to $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • SATCQ

    Solar module component maker SatCon (SATC -23.8%) continues its year-long swoon after reporting...

    Solar module component maker SatCon (SATC -23.8%) continues its year-long swoon after reporting Q2 revenue of $45.5M (+65% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.18, missing consensus by $0.4M and $0.06. Gross margin fell to 8% from 20.8% in Q2 2010. The company expects Q3 revenue of $45M-$52M, well below a $62M consensus. (previously) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon's (VZ +0.4%)  CEO stands his ground and reiterates today at a tech conference that...

    Verizon's (VZ +0.4%)  CEO stands his ground and reiterates today at a tech conference that labor contracts need to be changed, a proposal the union finds unacceptable with the firm profitable. Also a hot issue for VZ right now is the iPhone 5: When will it come? And how much can it add to the bottom line?

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • SCGLY

    As shares of SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY), Unicredit (OTCPK:UNCFF), and other leading European banks...

    As shares of SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY), Unicredit (OTCPK:UNCFF), and other leading European banks plummet, fears of a new credit crunch are gaining steam. Banks are increasingly turning to the ECB for short-term borrowings, and prices for credit-default swaps on their debt are taking off, though they still remain well below 2008 levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • LGF.A

    Movie and TV studio Lionsgate (LGF) is up 2.1% after reporting Q2 revenue of $261.3M (-20% Y/Y)...

    Movie and TV studio Lionsgate (LGF) is up 2.1% after reporting Q2 revenue of $261.3M (-20% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.09, compared with a consensus of $319.9M and -$0.07. Motion picture revenue declined 29% Y/Y, but television production revenue rose 27%. The company's filmed entertainment backlog rose to a record $546M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • KELYA

    Kelly Services (KELYA +6.8%) jumps as Q2 profit soars on demand for temporary staffing. The...

    Kelly Services (KELYA +6.8%) jumps as Q2 profit soars on demand for temporary staffing. The temp-staffing company has benefited from the weak economy as employers have been hesitant to take on permanent employees, opting for a more conservative "temp-to-hire" approach.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • MKTG

    Marketing software developer Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG) is up 11.2% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Marketing software developer Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG) is up 11.2% after reporting Q2 revenue of $33.7M (+56% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.07, beating consensus by $3.2M and $0.04. The company expects Q3 revenue of $33.5M and EPS of $0.03 - the former is above consensus by $2.2M, while the latter is in-line. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -9.5%) puts pressure on an already weak energy sector today, after its Q2...

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -9.5%) puts pressure on an already weak energy sector today, after its Q2 profits badly missed estimates due to lower natural gas production levels. Separately, Howard Weil downgrades the stock to outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +5.5%) receives a needed lifeline from Citi with an upgrade to Buy from Hold...

    OpenTable (OPEN +5.5%) receives a needed lifeline from Citi with an upgrade to Buy from Hold mainly on valuation. Shares of the online restaurant-booker still trade 48% off of 52-week highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment

  • Gold touches $1,800/oz. for the first time ever before pulling back as stocks bounce 1% off...

    Gold touches $1,800/oz. for the first time ever before pulling back as stocks bounce 1% off their lows. The yellow metal is currently +2.7% at $1,789.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 2 Comments

  • Stock market declines could be a precursor to even sharper drops in commodity prices if history...

    Stock market declines could be a precursor to even sharper drops in commodity prices if history repeats itself, writes Stuart Burns at MetalMiner. Metals sensitive to economic production are especially at risk. Commodity decliners today: Aluminum (ALUM) -1.4%, Copper (JJC) -3.9%, Tin (JJT) -1%, Steel (SLX) -3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • AMRC

    Ameresco (AMRC -14%) trades lower after reporting its Q2 EPS was in-line with estimates, but...

    Ameresco (AMRC -14%) trades lower after reporting its Q2 EPS was in-line with estimates, but revenues were lower-than-expected. Net income actually rose 15% Y/Y on a 23% jump in energy-efficiency revenue, but renewable-energy revenue slumped on scaled-back demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • EPOC

    Drug reference tool provider Epocrates (NASDAQ:EPOC) falls 39% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Drug reference tool provider Epocrates (NASDAQ:EPOC) falls 39% after reporting Q2 revenue of $27.9M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.13 (boosted by a one-time gain), compared with a consensus of $29.6M and $0.07. 2011 revenue guidance of $115M-$120M and EPS guidance of $0.01-$0.10 is below a consensus of $124.4M and $0.40. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • PTNR

    Partner Communications (PTNR -19%) is getting hit today after its Q2 EPS misses on a 30% drop in...

    Partner Communications (PTNR -19%) is getting hit today after its Q2 EPS misses on a 30% drop in Q2 profits. The company has been struggling with regulatory changes that came on line earlier this year. In light of those changes,  CFO Emanuel Avner says "we are witnessing a material reduction in the profitability of cellular services."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences' (CSC -15.9%) FQ1 earnings were up over 28% Y/Y, largely due to a one-time tax...

    Computer Sciences' (CSC -15.9%) FQ1 earnings were up over 28% Y/Y, largely due to a one-time tax charge, but the shares are down this morning over a sharp drop in margins on higher admin and legal expenses. The company also reduces its operating margin forcast for FY12, but left revenue guidance unchanged.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • PRMW

    Bottled water distributor Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW) is down 54% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Bottled water distributor Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW) is down 54% after reporting Q2 revenue of $20.7M (+70% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.01, below a consensus of $25.2M and $0.05. The company expects negative EPS and below-consensus revenue for the next 2 quarters, making its 2012 EPS guidance of $0.63-$0.72 hard for the Street to buy into.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • CREE

    More on Cree's (CREE +13.5%) bounce: Cantor Fitzgertald Analyst Dale Pfau says margins should...

    More on Cree's (CREE +13.5%) bounce: Cantor Fitzgertald Analyst Dale Pfau says margins should improve, and recommends investors "aggressively accumulate shares at the current depressed valuation."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • PEGA

    Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA), a developer of business process automation software, is up 20.4%...

    Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA), a developer of business process automation software, is up 20.4% after reporting Q2 revenue of $104.7M (+22% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16, beating consensus by $3.1M and $0.02. The company reports the value of executed licensing deals increased Q/Q, and was "significantly higher" than in Q2 2010. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM

  • Sunoco (SUM +2.8%) moves higher in a brutal tape after announcing a share repurchase program of...

    Sunoco (SUM +2.8%) moves higher in a brutal tape after announcing a share repurchase program of up to $500M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • BA

    Shares of Boeing (BA -4.5%) suffer along with the rest of the market, but the firm picks up a...

    Shares of Boeing (BA -4.5%) suffer along with the rest of the market, but the firm picks up a tidy $3.3B order from Hong Kong-carrier Cathay Pacific for delivery between 2013 and 2016. The airliner says it received "significant price concessions" from BA to lock-in the order.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • AVT

    Avnet (NASDAQ:AVT) is up 6.7% after reporting FQ4 results. While FQ1 2012 EPS guidance of...

    Avnet (NASDAQ:AVT) is up 6.7% after reporting FQ4 results. While FQ1 2012 EPS guidance of $0.90-$0.98 is below a $1.03 consensus, revenue guidance is roughly in-line. The numbers are being well-received by a market that was assuming the worst following weak guidance from rival ARW, and Goldman's downgrade of the IT supply chain space. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +16.1%) pops after the firm posted Q4 earnings that beat estimates on lower non-GAAP...

    Cree (CREE +16.1%) pops after the firm posted Q4 earnings that beat estimates on lower non-GAAP earnings from a year ago. Shares gained 10% AH last night before tacking on another 6%, apparently on momentum.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • IL

    IntraLinks Holdings (IL -37.4%) gets hammered after reporting an in-line Q2, but reducing Q3 EPS...

    IntraLinks Holdings (IL -37.4%) gets hammered after reporting an in-line Q2, but reducing Q3 EPS guidance due to higher operating and material costs. The stock has been struggling since May, losing over 80% of its value and now trading through its August, 2010 IPO issue price, hitting an all-time low.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • SCGLY

    Reuters reports a Societe Generale (OTCPK:SCGLY) spokeswoman denying all rumors about the bank....

    Reuters reports a Societe Generale (OTCPK:SCGLY) spokeswoman denying all rumors about the bank. Still down sharply, European shares have rallied about 2.5% in the last few minutes. Stoxx 50 -4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • DIS

    Shares of Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS), down as much as 14%, are now 11.4% lower as investors digest...

    Shares of Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS), down as much as 14%, are now 11.4% lower as investors digest the prospect for strong theme park attendance and advertising revenue in a sputtering economy. RBC Capital checks in on the stock by reiterating its Outperform rating, and dropping its price target to $43 from $48.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • NUAN

    Voice recognition software firm Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) rises 6.7% after reporting earnings. While...

    Voice recognition software firm Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) rises 6.7% after reporting earnings. While FQ3 results were mixed, the company is raising its FQ4 revenue guidance to $380M-$390M, an increase of about $10M after accounting for recent acquisitions. FQ4 EPS guidance of $0.38-$0.41 is in-line with a $0.40 consensus. (PR) (prepared remarks) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM

  • Stocks are at their lows of the session, with the DJIA -3.5% giving up yesterday's gains. The...

    Stocks are at their lows of the session, with the DJIA -3.5% giving up yesterday's gains. The Nasdaq -3.2%. In Europe: Stoxx 50 -4.6%, Italy -4.8%, France -4%, Germany -4.5%, U.K. -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • UAL

    Airline stocks (FAA -2.%) continue to gyrate wildly, declining wider than the broad market as...

    Airline stocks (FAA -2.%) continue to gyrate wildly, declining wider than the broad market as investors fear a profit squeeze for carriers. Early losers: UAL -5.9%, DAL -5.8%, JBLU -8.3%, LCC -6.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • SCGLY

    Societe Generale (OTCPK:SCGLY -15.5%) is in freefall, now quoted -17% in Paris as rumors swirl...

    Societe Generale (OTCPK:SCGLY -15.5%) is in freefall, now quoted -17% in Paris as rumors swirl of an emergency meeting with President Sarkozy. FT Alphaville posits that the bank's exposure to the rocketing Swiss franc could be a source of its troubles.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • CKP

    Check Point Systems (CKP +1%) rises on a down day as 4.9% shareholder MMI Investments recommends...

    Check Point Systems (CKP +1%) rises on a down day as 4.9% shareholder MMI Investments recommends the company explore a sale. MMI believes Checkpoint could be sold at a share price in the "low-to-mid $20s," a solid premium from its current trading price of $14.52.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • IRE

    Bank of Ireland (NYSE:IRE) H1 underlying loss €723M ($1.04B) vs. €1.32B a year...

    Bank of Ireland (NYSE:IRE) H1 underlying loss €723M ($1.04B) vs. €1.32B a year earlier. Impairment charges on loans to customers €842M vs. €1.08B. Confirms the Irish government's stake will fall to 15% when outside investors complete a €1.1B stock purchase. Shares -7.1%. (PR .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • MRK

    Adolor (ADLR) announces positive results from its Phase 2 studies of a non-cancer OIC and GI...

    Adolor (ADLR) announces positive results from its Phase 2 studies of a non-cancer OIC and GI pain treatment. The firm's CEO says the drugmaker will initiate more studies and share data shortly. Shares +9.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • MRK

    Premarket gainers: WTLSA +13%. ADLR +12%. CREE +11%. RL +10%. LLNW +6%. PAL +5%. AU +3%. M +3%....

    Premarket gainers: WTLSA +13%. ADLR +12%. CREE +11%. RL +10%. LLNW +6%. PAL +5%. AU +3%. M +3%. COF +3%. VE +3%.
    Losers: MOTR -45%. CRH -5%. CTIC -5%. MT -5%. STD -5%. DIS -5%. NMR -4%. RIO -3%. E -3%. ING -3%. TS -3%. C -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • RL

    More on Polo Ralph Lauren's (NYSE:RL) FQ1 report: Y/Y sales increases: wholesale +29%, retail...

    More on Polo Ralph Lauren's (NYSE:RL) FQ1 report: Y/Y sales increases: wholesale +29%, retail +37%, licensing +6%. Sees FY12 consolidated revenues to grow briskly at a high-teens-to-low 20% rate, and retail sales by a mid-20% range. Lowers outlook for FY12 operating margin to down 50-100 bp on higher costs. Shares +9.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences (CSC): FQ1 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $4.03B (+3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Computer Sciences (CSC): FQ1 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $4.03B (+3% Y/Y) beats by $40M. Shares -2.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • M

    More on Macy's (NYSE:M) Q2 results: Same-store sales were up 6.4%, and online sales were up...

    More on Macy's (NYSE:M) Q2 results: Same-store sales were up 6.4%, and online sales were up 40.2%. Free cash flow was $362M, up from $59M in Q2 2010. The company is raising 2011 EPS guidance to $2.60-$2.65, above a $2.58 consensus. 2H same-store sales growth is expected to be 4%-4.5%. M +4.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • RL

    Polo Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL): FQ1 EPS of $1.90 beats by $0.44. Revenue of $1.5B (+33.4% Y/Y)...

    Polo Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL): FQ1 EPS of $1.90 beats by $0.44. Revenue of $1.5B (+33.4% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares +7.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • M

    Macy's (NYSE:M): Q2 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $5.94B (+7.3% Y/Y) beats by $70M....

    Macy's (NYSE:M): Q2 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $5.94B (+7.3% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares +2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
